skill.name: ReasoningBank with AgentDB
skill.description: Implement ReasoningBank adaptive learning with AgentDB's 150x faster vector database. Includes trajectory tracking, verdict judgment, memory distillation, and pattern recognition. Use when building self-learning agents, optimizing decision-making, or implementing experience replay systems.
skill.summary: Implement ReasoningBank adaptive learning with AgentDB's 150x faster vector database. Includes traje...
skill.author: ruvnet

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown and TypeScript API examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem operations, or environment variable access. Pure prompt-based skill with no security concerns.

content.user_title: Build self-learning AI agents with memory
content.value_statement: AI agents struggle to learn from past experiences and improve over time. ReasoningBank provides adaptive learning patterns using AgentDB's high-performance vector database so agents can track trajectories, judge outcomes, and distill memories into reusable patterns.
actual_capabilities: Track agent execution paths and outcomes with trajectory tracking
Judge whether strategies were successful using verdict judgment
Consolidate experiences into reusable patterns with memory distillation
Find similar successful patterns using pattern matching with MMR
Synthesize context from multiple memories for better decisions
Automatically optimize and prune memories with the MemoryOptimizer
limitations: Requires Node.js 18+ and AgentDB v1.0.7+ to function
Does not include the actual AgentDB implementation code
Learning effectiveness depends on quality and quantity of stored experiences
Domain knowledge must be explicitly categorized for effective retrieval

use_cases.title: Build adaptive AI systems
use_cases.description: Create AI agents that learn from experience and improve decision-making over time using pattern matching and memory consolidation.

use_cases.title: Implement experience replay
use_cases.description: Build reinforcement learning systems that store, retrieve, and learn from successful agent trajectories and outcomes.

use_cases.title: Add memory to AI assistants
use_cases.description: Give Claude Code agents persistent memory so they remember solutions that worked across sessions and conversations.

prompt_templates.title: Store a solution
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ReasoningBank to store this solution as an experience pattern. Include the problem description, approach taken, and outcome. Set confidence to 0.95.

prompt_templates.title: Find similar solutions
prompt_templates.prompt: Search ReasoningBank for similar past solutions to [describe your problem]. Use MMR for diverse results and synthesize context to understand patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Judge a trajectory
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this agent execution trajectory. Was it successful? Compare it to similar past patterns. Return a verdict and confidence score.

prompt_templates.title: Distill experiences
prompt_templates.prompt: Consolidate all experiences in the [domain] domain into high-level patterns. Identify common approaches and success rates. Store distilled patterns.

output_examples.input: Store this solution: I fixed a slow API endpoint by adding eager loading to eliminate N+1 queries, then added Redis caching. Latency dropped from 2500ms to 150ms.
output: Pattern: API optimization with eager loading + caching
Available for retrieval in future optimization tasks

best_practices: Categorize experiences by domain for targeted retrieval and cleaner pattern matching
Use high confidence scores (0.8+) when storing verified successful patterns
Enable memory optimization periodically to consolidate similar experiences
anti_patterns: Storing every minor action as a separate experience without consolidation
Using the same domain for unrelated patterns making retrieval noisy
Skipping trajectory tracking after complex tasks losing valuable learning data

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. Requires Node.js 18+ and AgentDB v1.0.7+.

faq.question: How fast is pattern retrieval?
faq.answer: AgentDB provides 150x faster pattern retrieval than legacy systems with sub-millisecond access.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing code?
faq.answer: Yes. AgentDB maintains 100% backward compatibility with the legacy ReasoningBank API.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Data is stored locally in the AgentDB database. No external data transmission occurs by design.

faq.question: Why are my confidence scores low?
faq.answer: Low confidence typically means insufficient similar experiences. Enable context synthesis and add more examples.

faq.question: How is this different from regular memory?
faq.answer: ReasoningBank uses vector embeddings for semantic similarity, automatic pattern consolidation, and trajectory-based learning rather than simple key-value storage.
